subject: Law
title: Affirmative Action in Law
description: A fast breakdown of Affirmative Action in Law for builders.

hook.text: Should universities consider race in admissions to fix past discrimination? The Supreme Court changed its mind.

buildup.text: Affirmative action uses race-conscious policies to address historical inequities in education and employment.

discovery.text: Grutter v. Bollinger (2003) upheld race-conscious admissions, saying diversity is a compelling educational interest.

twist.text: In 2023, the Court overruled Grutter in SFFA v. Harvard, barring race-based admissions at colleges.

climax.text: Schools now seek diversity through race-neutral means: socioeconomic factors, geography, and first-generation status.

punchline.text: The goal is equality. The legal path keeps shifting.

quiz.question: What did SFFA v. Harvard decide about race in college admissions?
